    • Method Detail

      • addState

        public void addState(java.lang.String state)
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Creates a new State with the given name and adds it to the list of states.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a state with the given name already exists

      • getState

        public State<I,O> getState(java.lang.String state)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Return the state that has the given name
        Returns:
        The State with the given name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no such state

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(java.lang.String startState,
                 I input,
                 java.lang.String targetState,
                 O output)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds a Transition to startState
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if either startState or targetState don't exist

      • setCurrentState

        public void setCurrentState(java.lang.String state)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the current State
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is no such state

      • getCurrentState

        public State<I,O> getCurrentState()
        Returns the current State
        Returns:
        The current state or null if no stage has been set before

      • isInAcceptedState

        public boolean isInAcceptedState()
        Returns:
        True if currentState is accepted, false otherwise or if currentState is null

      • transit

        public void transit(I input)
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Does the Transition to the next State that is determined by the input and processes the output from the Transition.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the current State is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there is no Transition for the given input

      • getTransition

        public Transition<O> getTransition(I input)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Gets the transition that would occur with the given input. This method does NOT actually perform the transition
        Returns:
        Said transition or null if there would be no transition with the given input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no state has been set as the current one

      • processOutput

        protected abstract void processOutput(O output)
